title: Remove public login UI and restrict publishing to the site owner only

requirements.text: Remove all public-facing login/logout and profile-setup UX from the site layout so visitors cannot see or use any authentication controls (no login button, no logout button, no profile setup modal).

quotes: remove login feature and only i will publish it's artical and image

acceptanceCriteria: The header navigation in SiteLayout no longer renders the LoginButton component.
ProfileSetupModal is not rendered on public pages (or at all).
No user-facing page shows buttons/links labeled "Login" or "Logout" to general visitors.

requirements.text: Keep the admin/editor pages protected so that only the site owner can access create/edit/publish/unpublish actions; non-owners must not be able to publish articles or upload images even if they discover admin routes.

quotes: remove login feature and not anyone can publish articals
remove login feature and only i will publish it's artical and image

acceptanceCriteria: All backend content-mutation methods (createArticle, updateArticle, publishArticle, unpublishArticle) continue to reject non-owner callers with an unauthorized error.

Admin UI routes (/admin, /admin/articles/new, /admin/articles/:id/edit) remain inaccessible to non-owners (they see an access denied / authentication required experience and cannot reach editing controls).
Image upload functionality used by the editor cannot successfully upload/store images for non-owner callers.

requirements.text: Adjust admin gating UI text to reflect owner-only access and remove any implication that the site supports general user accounts (use English text).

quotes: remove login feature and only i will publish it's artical and image

acceptanceCriteria: Admin guard screens/messages refer to "Owner access" or "Admin access" and do not instruct general visitors to create a profile.
All user-facing authentication/access-denied strings shown by admin gating components are in English.

constraints: Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui (read-only shadcn components).
Do not edit immutable paths: frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx.
Backend must remain a single Motoko actor in backend/main.mo; only add backend/migration.mo changes if a stable-state upgrade is required.
nonGoals: Adding third-party authentication providers (only Internet Identity is available).
Adding multi-user roles, invitations, or a public registration system.
Changing the public content model beyond the login/publishing restrictions (Articles-only remains as-is).
